item.title: Introduction to open source private LTE and 5G networks | Ubuntu
item.description: It’s so easy these days to set-up your own WiFi network. You order a router online, plug it into the electrical socket, define a password and you’re good to go. WiFi is fast, reliable and easy to use. But if you want to cover a wider area or connect hundreds of small devices it quickly […]

item.title: 8K Vrroom 40Gbps | HDFury.com | Connect and Fix everything in HDMI
item.description: The Vrroom Kit includes: Vrroom unit Choice of power supply IR RX Sensor cable (9ft) DB9 > RS232 jack cable (1ft) Jack Optical cable (4.5ft) Downscale, Passthru or Upscale VRR or ANY signal while extracting full audio from ANY HDMI source to feed ANY Audio sound system with the best possible audio formats! WORLD’S FIRST VRR and HDMI 2.1 sound extractor that allows FULL AUDIO from ANY external HDMI source to ANY HDMI/ARC or eARC sound system. State of the art HDMI 2.1 central that support ANY video and/or audio signal in existence today including VRR, DV, LLDV, HLG, HDR10+, DTS:X, ATMOS and more... Vrroom allows ANY HDMI source (FUHD sources, Blu-ray, UHD Blu-ray, media players, satellite receiver, game consoles, PCs, etc.) to be shown on ANY of the connected displays and ANY sources Full HDMI audio to be played on ANY AVR or sound system.

item.title: Welcome to Cloudflare Impact Week
item.description: This week we kick off Cloudflare's first Impact Week. We originally conceived the idea of the week as a way to highlight some of the things we were doing as a company around our environmental, social, and governance (ESG) initiatives.
item.author: (Matthew Prince)

item.title: Agile at 20: The Failed Rebellion
item.description: The Agile Manifesto turned 20 this year, and there are two facts that seem self-evident: Agile, as a label, won; nobody wants to be called non-Agile.

item.title: Damn Interesting: To H-E-Double-Hockey-Sticks With Facebook
Is It Possible To Make IoT Devices Private? Amazon Echo Dot Does Not Wipe Personal Content After Factory Reset
item.description: IoT devices that record copious details of the daily lives of users raise natural privacy concerns. A history-clearing factory reset on the Echo Dot does not appear to clear that data.
item.author: (Data PrivacyNews·4 min read)

item.title: How Empty Storefronts Are Killing Our Neighbourhoods
item.description: All over North America, speculators are raising rents and pushing out tenants. Will our cities ever be the same?

item.title: Electromagnetism is a property of spacetime itself, study finds
item.description: Imagine if we could use strong electromagnetic fields to manipulate the local properties of spacetime—this could have important ramifications in terms of science and engineering.
